item.title: Untamed overgrowth, 11th April
item.description:
Previous and current landlord / homeowner have not sufficiently managed trees / vegetation to rear of their property despite request to do so. One includes an elder that has grown into a 2 story high tree that is abundant with berries in the Autumn, hence vermin food-source. Evergreens at front and rear of property are over the height of the 2 story building. It has created habitat for pests (juvenile rats) who have entered my garden. The rats have burrowed under adjoining fence. As advised by the tenant at 41 Churchdown Lane I have removed bird seed from my bird table. There are no other accessible food sources on my property. There is considerable block of sunlight in the garden of 41 from garden of 43 which in turn affects my garden. Furthermore, there is an empty property adjoining the gardens west side of 41,43,45 and 47 Churchdown Lane, (in Zoons Road). Again, with inadequately managed gardens. I believe the landlord to 41 is Michael Tuck and to 47 C&G lettings.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Zoons Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
